title: Niner Bikes Is Back with the ORE 9 RDO
content:
After a brief hiatus, Niner Bikes is back with the release of the second offering in their gravel category, the ORE 9 RDO. The ORE is a rowdy gravel rig with slackened geometry and longer wheelbase, complementing Niner’s RLT family…

ORE stands for Off Road Explorer and is “the mountain biker’s gravel bike.” It is designed to play within terrain that normal gravel road racing bikes might feel under-equipped.

ORE 9 RDO Quick Hits

  • $2,999.99 frameset
  • $4,299.99 Apex XPLR
  • $5,299.99 GRX 800
  • Carbon RDO frame & fork, tested to MTB ISO Standards
  • 700 x 50 mm tire clearance
  • Head tube angle 69°
  • Seat tube angle 74° (47, 50, 53cm) / 73° (56, 59, 62cm)
  • Fork rake 50mm
  • Chainstay length 430mm
  • Seatpost diameter 27.2, internal dropper routing-ready
  • Rear wheel spacing 12×142
  • Max Chainring size 1x 48t, 2x 50/34t
  • Di2 and AXS compatible
  • Full sleeve internal cable routing

ORE 9 RDO Geometry

ORE is suspension-corrected, has a 69 degree headtube angle, 74 degree seat tube angle, 50 degree fork rake, and 430mm horizontal chainstay, with 70mm BB drop. Compared to the RLT the ORE has a longer wheelbase, similar reach, and increased trail.

Chassis

ORE 9 RDO is lighter, yet stiffer than the RLT 9 RDO. The RDO fork is also slimmed down, losing all mounting points lending to a sleek look. The suspension-corrected frame is compatible with up to 40mm suspension fork. Full sleeve internal routing allows for dropper post installation. T47 bottom bracket and UDH allow for greater serviceability and breadth of drivetrain choices. Fitments on top tube, inner frame, two bottle mounts inside triangle, and one bottle mount under the downtube.

Offerings

ORE 9 RDO will be offered in 2 builds. The Satin Magnetic Grey colorway will be equipped with SRAM APEX 1 XPLR 12sp and the Transparent Green will be spec’d with Shimano GRX 800 1x 12sp. A frame only option will also be available. Please see website for current pricing in each region.
